title: Tech Stocks Attracting the Most Investors
text: Many cautious investors in recent years have shed their wariness of tech and bought shares of high-flying companies that are building the future.

title: 68% of Facebook investors vote to oust Zuckerberg as chairman
text: Trillium Asset Management Senior Vice President Jonas Kron discusses why shareholders are pushing to oust Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg.

title: Facebook Investors Revolt Again. Zuckerberg Shuts Them Down Again.
text: The social network's shareholders are calling for change. Facebook won't.

title: Facebook shareholders call for Zuckerberg’s ouster as chairman
text: Even Facebook’s investors are fed up with Mark Zuckerberg. Pension funds on Tuesday called for the 35-year-old tech tycoon to be replaced as chairman of the social network by an independent director, citing a shareholder vote last week that revealed strong support for the idea.

title: Google, Facebook, Amazon, Apple face antitrust scrutiny
text: Government regulators have negotiated to split up oversight of Google, Facebook, Amazon and Apple, with the Department of Justice and Federal Trade Commission moving toward a new probe of Google, according to reporting by CNN's Brian Fung.

title: Top tech executives will be asked to testify in U.S. probe
text: Leaders of big tech companies will be asked to testify as part of an investigation into whether the companies misuse their massive market power, the head of the U.S. House Judiciary subcommittee leading the probe said on Tuesday.

title: Facebook Falls - Your Course Of Action
text: Market worries over Facebook, how should you react? You should not.

title: FANG Stocks: Breakup Risks Are Relatively Low?
text: Amazon.com, Apple, Facebook and Google-parent Alphabet have taken a beating lately as investors worry about government and court actions defanging their businesses. FANG stocks have fallen.

title: Facebook shares fall as the company faces new probes
text: Facebook is facing new federal probes and privacy concerns, and that sent shares tumbling.

title: Tech Turmoil
text: Mark May, Citi internet analyst, and David Rolfe, Wedgewood Partners portfolio manager and CIO, join "Squawk Alley" to discuss the antitrust probes into major tech companies like Google, Apple and Facebook.

title: Facebook in Active Dialogue With CFTC Over Digital Payments
text: Reportedly, Facebook (FB) is in active discussions with Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) over its new digital currency initiative.

title: Facebook fails to stop Europe’s top court weighing in on EU-US data transfers
text: Facebook has failed in its last ditch attempt to block a referral by Ireland’s High Court of questions over the legality of EU-US data transfer mechanisms to the region’s top court. Ireland’s Supreme Court unanimously refused its request to appeal the decision Friday, via Reuters.

title: Apple didn't just take the high ground on privacy, it twisted the knife into Google and Facebook
text: Apple now requires apps that use Facebook or Google sign-in options to use its new privacy-focused Log in with Apple service.

title: Tuesday’s Vital Data: Facebook, Salesforce and Twitter
text: Options trading was hot in Facebook, Salesforce and Twitter on Monday. Here’s what the data suggests moving forward.

title: Facebook and Alphabet selloffs look like an 'overreaction' to reports of potential probes, says Cowen
text: Cowen & Co. analyst John Blackledge argued that selloffs in Facebook Inc. FB, -0.73% and Alphabet Inc.

title: Big tech antitrust investigations will likely take years, WSJ reporter says
text: Keach Hagey, reporter for the Wall Street Journal, and Scott Kupor, managing partner at Andreessen Horowitz, join "Squawk Box" to discuss the government's scrutiny of big tech companies.

title: Facebook can be told to cast a wider net to find illegal content, says EU court advisor
text: How much of an obligation should social media platforms be under to hunt down illegal content? An influential advisor to Europe’s top court has taken the view that social media platforms like Facebook can be required to seek out and identify posts that are equivalent to content that an EU court has deemed illegal — […]

title: The U.S. Government Has Big Tech in Its Crosshairs
text: Antitrust regulators are reportedly stepping up their scrutiny of the biggest tech companies.

title: EU court advisor: Facebook can be ordered to seek out illegal comments
text: Facebook could be ordered to seek out all content on its platform identical to that found to be illegal by a court injunction, an advisor said.
